origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.)

custodhist.p: Clerk of Superior Court, Register of Deeds

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Sampson County was established in 1784 from Duplin County. Some early court records are missing. Partial causes may have been the actions of Federal sympathizers in 1865 and a clerk's office fire in 1921.
The deed books of Duplin County prior to 1784 are among the records of Sampson County.

controlaccess.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series may include Apprentice Bonds, Bastardy Bonds, Official Bonds and Records of county officials, Oaths taken by county officials, and other miscellaneous bonds and records pertaining to legal responsibilities of service granted through the courts, as well as Assumed Business Names, Corporations, and Partnerships and Brands or Marks registered in the county and Licenses and Registrations of merchants and professionals kept by the county.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes volumes and boxes of bastardy bonds, arranged chronologically. Other papers may include presentments against and examinations of unwed mothers and mothers-to-be, warrants to bring the putative fathers to court, and receipts for payments made on behalf of bastard children.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Records pertaining to or created by the administrative bodies of the county, including but not limited to the county Board of Commissioners, Board of Education, Board of Health. May includes County Accounts and Claims, Journals and Ledgers of County Officials, and/or Records of Wardens of the Poor, as well as record documenting county boundaries and changes thereto.
See series 1, Bonds, Licenses, Oaths, and Registrations, for Oaths of county officials, and series 3, Court Records, for other records pertaining to county administration, if available.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records pertaining to accounts and claims against the county for services rendered. Volumes include County Claim Allowed.

did.unittitle: Records of the Wardens of the Poor
did.container: Minutes of the Wardens of the Poor (Vestry Minutes)

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Records concerning the care of the poor and infirm, a function of the counties before it was assumed by the State Board of Charities and Public Welfare in 1917. In colonial times, care for the poor was an ecclesiastical responsibility; records from this period may be found in vestry minutes. From 1777 to 1868, maintenance of the unfortunate was entrusted to the Wardens of the Poor; after 1868, the Board of County Commissioners assumed the responsibility. Volumes may include vestry minutes, minutes and accounts of the Wardens of the Poor, accounts and registers of the county home, and accounts of outside poor (impoverished persons living at home rather than in the county home).
Other terms for these records: Parish Books or Parish Accounts.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.)

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical
bioghist.p:
County Courts of Pleas and Quarter Sessions evolved from precinct courts in 1738. The courts were composed of three or more Justices of the Peace and sat four times each year. The functions of county courts may be categorized into three distinct areas-judicial, probate and administrative-that are reflected in the minute dockets. The courts exercised both civil and criminal jurisdiction, original and appellate (from magistrates courts). Probate responsibilities included acknowledgment and probate of deeds; probate of wills; appointment and qualification of administrators, executors and guardians; binding of apprentices; and inquisitions of lunacy. The court also served as the governing body of the county, responsible for the appointment and qualification of local officials, levying of local taxes, expenditure of public funds, granting of licenses (tavern keepers, ferry operators, and peddlers), registration of stock marks, paternity inquisitions, and emancipation and manumission of slaves.
Courts of Pleas and Quarter Sessions were abolished by the Constitution of 1868. The judicial functions devolved to county Superior Courts and Justices of the Peace Courts; the probate function was vested in the clerk of Superior Court; and administrative responsibilities were inherited by the newly created Boards of County Commissioners. Superior Courts were established in each county in 1806, replacing the district superior courts that had functioned since 1778. Originally, the county Superior Court sat twice each year, spring and fall terms, with six judges riding circuit. Each county had separate clerks for Law and for Equity. These courts had original and appellate civil and criminal jurisdiction, as well as jurisdiction over actions in equity. Criminal jurisdiction extended to serious felonies, such as murder, rape, larceny, house breaking, assault and battery, riot, and forgery; civil jurisdiction extended to suits involving $100 or more (after 1868, $200 or more). Other matters assigned to Superior Court included legitimization of bastards, emancipation and manumission of slaves, registration of aliens, and hearing of grand jury presentments and reports. Later, matters handled before a clerk were classified in Special Proceedings and Orders and Decrees, which included things such as adoptions, name changes, incompetency hearings, and many estate and guardian matters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
This series includes records pertaining to the administration and actions of the county court system, particularly Civil and Criminal Actions before a jury and other actions before the court or the clerk, such as Special Proceedings. The dominant court prior to 1868 was known as the Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions; after court reform circa 1868, it was known as the Superior Court.
For court records concerning land and property matters, see also series 4, Land and Property Records. For records pertaining to Wills and Estate matters, see also series 5, Estates Records and Wills. For Adoptions, see also series 6, Marriage, Divorce and Vital Statistics. Series 10, subseries 928, may also contain loose court records.

did.unittitle: Minute Dockets, Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions and Superior Court

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The minute dockets record the daily transactions of the court, generally recording judgments in civil and criminal actions or documenting non-juried matters. They also reflect the internal workings of the court, recording the appointment and qualification of clerks, the summoning and impaneling of juries, and the hearing of grand jury reports.

did.unittitle: Appearance and Reference Dockets, Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions and Superior Court

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Records include Appearance Dockets for the Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions and Superior Court, which list civil cases to appear for any other purpose than jury trial, including preliminary proceedings, and document issuance of writs, summonses, and subpoenas as well as appeals from lower courts and proceedings by petition. Dockets show names of parties, nature of action, and summaries of pleadings or proceedings. Later Appearance Dockets usually were merely lists of persons bonded or otherwise held to appear before court in criminal matters, including persons on probation and material witnesses.
Prior to 1820, both Appearance Dockets and Reference Dockets were often kept in same volume with Trial Dockets, which are listed in subseries CV, Civil Dockets, if available.

did.unittitle: Appearance Docket, Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions

Appearance Docket, Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions

Appearance Docket, Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Record of issuance of writs, summonses and subpoenas to bring defendants and witnesses to following term of court. Also records appearances of appeals from magistrates' courts and of proceedings by petition (sometimes recorded in separate Petitions Docket). Columnar arrangement shows number of case and name or initials of attorneys; names of parties; form of action; disposition of writ; and any rule or action taken by court at term, including confessed judgments. Prior to 1820, appearance dockets were often kept in same volume with trial dockets.
Volumes span the following dates: 1821-1833 1833-1842 1853-1861 1861-1868

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Record of issuance of writs, summonses and subpoenas to bring defendants and witnesses to following term of court. Also records appearances of appeals from lower courts and of proceedings by petition (sometimes recorded in separate Petitions Docket). Columnar arrangement shows number of case and name or initials of attorneys; names of parties; form of action; disposition of writ; and any rule or action taken by court at term, including confessed judgments. After 1868, the functions of the appearance docket were continued with some modifications in the Summons Docket.

did.unittitle: Judgment/Execution Dockets, Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions and Superior Court

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Equity Execution Dockets and Execution Dockets record the names of all parties involved in compensatory judgments awarded by the Court of Equity or Superior Court. Information includes names of parties to action; nature of action; amount of judgment; bill of costs; type of writ issued, its execution; satisfaction of judgment, in the case of Equity Execution Dockets; and sheriff's return. After 1868, in most counties this information was recorded in Judgment Dockets, although some continued to use separate Execution Dockets.

did.unittitle: Civil Dockets, Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions and Superior Court

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Record of civil causes expected to come to trial during term. Brings forward information from Appearance Docket and also shows pleadings of defendant, prior to ruling by court, verdict, judgment, and final orders. In most counties prior to 1820, Appearance, Trial, and Reference Dockets were maintained in one civil docket at the convenience of the clerk. With the proliferation of cases after 1820, most clerks began keeping the various civil dockets in separate volumes. After 1868, this information was recorded in Civil Issues Dockets, including names of parties, history of cases carried forward from Summons Docket, and note of proceedings at trial. See also series AR, Appearance and Reference Docket.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Box C.R.087.929.2 contains records relating to the Clinton Loan Association, 1892-1907, including an 1882 map of the town of Clinton, with a key to dwellings and inhabitants.)
Includes boxes of records concerning assignees, receivers and trustees appointed to settle the financial affairs of bankrupt individuals and businesses. In some counties, the records are merged into one chronological series; in others, the records of the three types of agents have been separated. Also includes volumes of accounts of assignees, receivers and trustees.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Civil case files from magistrates courts, Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions, Superior Court, and, in some counties, other inferior courts. In most counties, also contains executions issued supplementary to civil judgments. Civil actions concerning are filed separately.
See also Court Records subseries 328, Executions; series 10, Miscellaneous Records, subseries 924, Personal Accounts, for merchant account related to bankruptcy filings; and/or series 10, subseries 928, Miscellaneous Records, for loose civil case files, if available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Processed criminal action papers (1790-1924) are arranged in chronological order and housed in 20 fibredex boxes numbered CR.087.325.1- CR.087.325.20.
Unprocessed criminal action papers, files #100-2,226 and #4,411-21,732 (1927-1960), are in roughly file number order and housed in 65 letter boxes.

scopecontent.p:
Processed criminal action papers (1823-1934) are arranged in chronological order and housed in 25 fibredex boxes numbered CR.087.326.1- CR.087.326.26. Unprocessed criminal action papers are in roughly alphabetical order and housed in 15 letter boxes.
Criminal case files from magistrates courts, Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions, Superior Court, and, in some counties, other inferior courts, usually arranged chronologically. In most counties, records also include executions issued supplementary to criminal actions. Series 10, subseries 928, Miscellaneous Records, may also include loose criminal actions.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes minute dockets from various inferior courts which were operational at times between the court reforms of 1868 and 1965, such as Criminal Court (in Craven, Mecklenburg, New Hanover and Wake counties), Inferior Court (1877-1885), Circuit Criminal Courts (reconstituted as Eastern/Western District Criminal Courts, 1895-1901), Recorders Court (1900-1970), and General County Court (1923-1970).

did.unittitle: Inebriates, Lunacy, and Judicial Hospitalizations Records

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: These records are restricted by NCGS 122C-207. Records will be open 100 years from date of record per NCGS 132-11.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Records include documentation of hearings for commitment of insane persons and inebriates, listing the name of the alleged lunatic, oaths of parties testifying to his/her lunacy, and copies of the clerk's order of commitment and the superintendent of the state hospital's order of release. Papers may include appointment of guardians to oversee the property of the unfit. After 1899, the clerk was required to keep lunacy matters in a distinct volume, entitled Record of Inquisition of Lunacy or simply Lunacy Docket. From 1868 to 1899, lunacy proceedings were recorded in the Orders and Decrees (922).
See also Court Records subseries 922, Orders and Decrees and Special Proceedings.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restriction
accessrestrict.p: Court records pertaining to judicial hospitalizations are closed per NCGS 122C-207. Records will be open 100 years from date of record per NCGS 132-11.

origination.label: creator

accessrestrict.head: Access Restriction
accessrestrict.p: Court records pertaining to judicial hospitalizations are closed per NCGS 122C-207. Records will be open 100 years from date of record per NCGS 132-11.

These have sometimes been distributed among other series of records based on subject: see also Court Records subseries 919, Inebriates, Lunacy, and Judicial Hospitalizations Records; series 4, Land and Property Records; series 5, Estates Records; and series 6, Marriage, Divorce, and Vital Statistics, subseries 604, Divorce Records, and subseries 901, Adoption Records, if available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to ownership, transfer, and taxing of land and property.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Register of Deeds.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restriction
accessrestrict.p: Records stored in the State Records Center require additional time to pull. Access to these records on Saturdays requires prior arrangements. Please consult the reference staff for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records are unprocessed. Records include original deeds left in the courthouse after being deposited with the clerk for probate and recording. These loose deeds can include various types such as deeds of sale, deeds of trust, mortgage deeds, and quitclaim (or release) deeds. Within these records, the seller is commonly referred to as the grantor, the buyer as grantee.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
May contain volumes and/or papers concerning divisions of land between tenants in common and the processioning of boundary lines between contentious neighbors. These records may include volumes of land division, Record of Surveys, and Record of Processions, as well as loose papers of petition for partition or sale of land (taken from actions at equity and, after 1868, Special Proceedings) and processioners' records.
See also series 3, Court Records, subseries 325, Civil Action Papers, and subseries 922, Orders and Decrees and Special Proceedings.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

did.container: Record of Land Sold for Taxes

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records may include volumes and/or papers pertaining to the sale of land for nonpayment of taxes.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: May contain two types of miscellaneous records: (1) papers from the other land records series that were of insufficient quantity to make up their own box and were thus comingled in the same box, and (2) true miscellaneous papers and volumes concerning land which do not fall into any of the enumerated land records series. These true miscellaneous records include condemnation proceedings; foreclosures; attachments, executions, liens, and levies on land; and volumes relating to the probate of deeds.

did.unittitle: Attachments, Executions, Liens, and Levies on Land
did.container: Attachments, Executions, Liens, and Levies on Land

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains commissions to take private examinations of various parties concerning conveyances, 1870; deeds, 1810, 1864, 1883, 1890, 1892, 1896, 1901; description of the land of Abram Hobbs, no date; ejectments, 1836- 1869 (broken series); ejectments (summary proceedings), 1870-1918 (broken series); ex parte proceedings concerning land, no date, 1860-1926 (broken series); in re: sale of the lands of Edd D. Kornegay and wife under mortgage sale, 1928; land entries, 1906-1909; land processions, 1874, 1876, 1878-1880, 1883; mortgage deeds, 1877, 1884, 1891, 1898, 1907; note for land, T.N. Culbreth and W.R. Culbreth to William McKenzie, 1859; plats, no date, 1888, 1889; receipts for land, 1867, 1870, 1895, 1908, 1909; reports of land sales, no date, 1846, 1867, 1868, 1896; surveyor's report of the county line between Sampson and New Hanover Counties, 1846-1847; transfer of bid for land, 1869.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: May contain records pertaining to insolvent debtors (1773-1868) and/or homestead and personal property exemptions (1868-). Records include applications of debtors, oaths, notices to creditors, property schedules of insolvents, and reports of committees to lay off homesteads exempted from forced sales. May also include homestead returns.

origination.label: creator

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
This series contains records related to the administration of deceased persons' property.
See also series 3, Court Records, subseries 922, Orders and Decrees and Special Proceedings, and series 4, Land and Property Records, for other records related to estates.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains bound volumes of account, inventory, and/or settlement records related to the administration and settling of deceased persons' property. These include Record of Estates (pre-1868), Record of Accounts (post-1868), Accounts of Sales and Resales of Estates, Record of Inheritance Tax, Inventories of Estates, Amounts Paid Indigent Children, and Record of Settlements. Prior to 1868, volumes entitled record of estates may include inventories, accounts and final settlements of estates, and guardians' accounts. After 1868, these volumes in most counties contain only inventories, accounts of sales and annual accounts of administrators and executors.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Prior to 1868, volumes entitled record of estates may include inventories, accounts and final settlements of estates, and guardians' accounts. After 1868, the series in most counties contains only inventories, accounts of sales and annual accounts of administrators and executors.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Twentieth-century record of settlement of tax assessed on estates worth more than $2000 provided to the clerk of superior court by the State Commissioner of Revenue. Statements include names of deceased and administrator or executor, approximate valuation of estate, and heirs or devisees. Loose papers concerning inheritance tax are filed in the series of estates records.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Volume 1. Twentieth-century record of Clerk of Superior Court in his administration of estates of less than $300 (later $500) which accrue to orphans without guardians. Also includes accounts of clerk in his capacity as receiver of estates of orphans without guardians.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: There are no records for 1935-1939. Volumes of settlements or final accounts submitted by administrators and executors after the complete distribution of the assets of an estate.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Alderman-Zachary. (Box CR.087.508.162 contains miscellaneous estates records, various dates).
Contains loose estate papers, which may include appointments and renunciations of executors and administrators; administrators' and guardians' bonds; inventories; accounts of sale; annual accounts; final settlements; civil actions and executions involving administrators, executors, and guardians; and actions in equity or special proceedings involving property of an estate. If the father of wards can be determined from guardians' papers, they are filed with the estate of the deceased rather than with the guardians' records.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains bound volumes and/or loose papers of bonds, appointments, and accounts of administrators, executors, and guardians. The loose papers consist primarily of guardians' records; loose administrators' bonds are generally filed in subseries 508, Estate/Accounts, Paper.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Volumes arranged chronologically. Loose bonds are filed in the series of Estates Records (508). After 1919, see Appointment and Record of Administrators (504).

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Post-1868 record of appointment and qualification of guardians. After 1919, includes oath and bond of guardians. Prior to ca. 1915, guardians were included in an omnibus volume entitled Appointment of Administrators, Executors, Guardians and Masters; in some counties, these are entitled Record of Probate (Estates) or Minutes, Probate Court (both in 519). May also include an index to guardians and wards.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Register of Deeds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Arranged alphabetically, Adams-Wynne (Box CR.087.510.32 contains miscellaneous guardians' records, various dates).
Loose guardians' papers arranged alphabetically by surname of wards, and volumes of guardians' accounts (but see 509). Papers may include appointments, oaths and bonds of guardians; annual accounts; final settlements; civil actions and executions involving guardians; and actions in equity or special proceedings involving the property of a ward's estate. These records also include indigent wards for whom the clerk of superior court served as receiver. If the father of the wards can be determined from the papers, they are filed with the estate of the deceased rather than with the guardians' records.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Volumes arranged chronologically. Loose bonds are filed in either the estates records (by decedent) or the guardians' records (by ward). After 1919, see Appointment and Record of Guardians (506).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains vital records pertaining to major life events such as marriage, divorce, adoption (restricted by statute), immigration and naturalization, death, and disinterment/reinterment.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains divorce actions pulled from Civil (and sometimes Criminal) Actions and/or record books of divorced women, which notes maiden name of divorcee and the date of notice of intention to resume maiden name. See also series 3, Court Records, for divorce case files, if available.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

did.unittitle: Record of Maiden Name of Divorced Women
did.container: Record of Maiden Name of Divorced Women

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Volume 1

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). County/District Health Departments.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Alphabetical by surname of deceased or cemetery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains county copies of permits to disinter bodies and rebury them.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains records pertaining to the naturalization of foreign-born citizens, in which the clerk of Superior Court acted as federal agent. May include Declaration of Intent to Become a Citizen, Petitions for Naturalization, and/or Alien Registration, which notes name, age, nationality, address, previous address, and the names and addresses of five persons who knew each foreign-born citizen registering.

origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Contains miscellaneous tax records relating to taxation, specifically actions against persons failing to list taxes, 1879-1922 (broken series); application of Eliza Bibb for repayment of direct tax, 1894; civil actions concerning taxes, 1885, 1888, 1911, 1913; criminal action concerning taxes, State vs. Board of County Commissioners of Sampson County, 1908; levies on land for taxes, 1872, 1874, 1875, 1896; list of taxes, 1871-1872; sheriff's allowance for insolvent taxables, 1789.
See series 4, Land and Property Taxes, for Inheritance Tax Records and series 5, Estate Records, for Land Sales for Taxes, if available.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.)

did.container: Bryant, Susan P. - Wiggins, Pauline B. Mrs.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.)

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.)

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Adams-Ziegler. Includes record of wills and original wills arranged alphabetically by decedent. Many of the older record of wills may also record estates matters (inventories, accounts of sale, and final settlements) and deeds. Recording of wills on a regular basis began about 1820. At a later date, wills that had been proved prior to 1820 as well as wills that had not be probated were entered into a record book identified as Will Book A. Excerpt from North Carolina Wills: A Testator Index, 1665-1900, by Thornton W. Mitchell (Raleigh: 1987).

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.)

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.)

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.)

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
This series may include Election Returns, in volumes and boxes; Permanent Registration of Voters (grandfather clause registrations, 1902-1908) volumes; and Poll Books deposited with the clerk of Superior Court. It may also include minutes of the county Board of Elections.
Boxes may include civil and criminal actions concerning elections (see series 3, Court Records, for civil and criminal case files, if available).

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Volumes span the following dates: 1878-1912 1906-1916 1920-1926.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.)

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series may include Armed Forces Discharges; Cemetery Records; Coroner's Inquests and Reports; Military Records; Pension Records; Personal Accounts; Road Records and Reports; School Records; and truly miscellaneous records collected from various county agencies and offices. Miscellaneous Records boxes may also include records from all other county series that were of insufficient quantity to make a full box.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Road Records may include volumes or boxes of records concerning appointment of road overseers, reports on condition of roads, and petitions for new roads. Boxes may also include criminal actions concerning negligence of overseers and claims against the county for services on the roads. Records concerning bridges and railroads are also included in this series, usually as separate subseries. Volumes may also include minutes of the county highway or good roads commission.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

did.unittitle: Record of Appointment of Road Overseers
did.container: Record of Appointment of Road Overseers

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Court of Pleas and Quarter Sessions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Volumes span the following dates: 1829-1842 1843-1849 1849-1868

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sampson County (N.C.). Clerk of Superior Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
In box CR.087.928.1: admittance of G.W. Britt to the Bar as an attorney, 1879; affidavits of Michael J. Bell (1863) and W.H. Darden (1875); agreement, Allmand T. Jackson to James K. Morisey, 1869; Aman Grocery Company, partnership, 1915; appointments of justices of the peace, 1866-1869; apprentice bonds and records, 1829-1897 (broken series); authorization to issue marriage license to Octavia J. Vann, minor, 1868; bridge records, no date, 1847-1868 (broken series); certificate of copartnership of the P.M. Bullard Company, 1918; certification of seeing notice by Parish, Roberson, and Treadwell, 1839; coroners' inquests, no date, 1830-1923 (broken series).
In box CR.087.928.2: correspondence, L.E. Warren to Jane Bradshaw, 1903-1906 (see Sampson County criminal action papers, 1906); correspondence, R.F. Pettigrew to the Raleigh News and Observer concerning Senator Marion Butler, 1910; correspondence to the clerks of superior court, 1870-1913 (broken series); county accounts, 1836-1910 (broken series); deputation of William B. Draughon in office of clerk of county court, 1864; docket (rough), 1 page, 1806; election records, no date, 1800, 1801, 1803, 1891, 1898; fragment of document signed by Hardy Holmes, clerk of court, 1801; governors' orders appointing judges to hold terms of court, 1886, 1898, 1903; grand jury reports, no date, 1868-1896 (broken series); in re: the custody of Mary Matilda Autry, 1875; in re: the legitimation of Malcolmb James Register, 1905; in re: the legitimation of Malinda Jane Rily, 1897; in re: Little Coharie Drainage District, 1915; insolvent debtors, 1854-1868 (broken series); insurance policies to various parties, 1870, 1871, 1891; inventories and accounts (unidentified), no date, 1798.
In box C.R.087.928.3: list of jurors, 1874; lunacy records, 1821-1905 (broken series); marriage contract, Thomas K. Bryan and others vs. William A. Faison and others, 1878; mill records, no date, 1813, 1854; notice of adoption of a corporate seal for the Board of Commissioners of Sampson County, 1888; oaths of officials, 1872-1928 (broken series); officials' bonds, 1834-1892 (broken series); order to sheriff to carry out execution (defendent unknown), no date; orders to issue licenses to retail spiritous liquors, 1840, 1841; pardon of Elias Pearsall, 1875; pardon of June Baggett and John McIlwame, 1892; personal accounts, no date, 1801-1921 (broken series); petition of Amos Maynard to be discharged from prison, 1872; petition of Simion Corbett for restoration of citizenship, 1892; petition of Taylor Faison for restoration of citizenship, 1896; petitions for naturalization, 1844, 1860, 1896, 1908; petitions for writs of habeas corpus, 1877-1920 (broken series); petitions to be discharged as insolvents, no date, 1871-1903 (broken series); powers of attorney, 1862, 1872, 1886, 1897, 1904; prison bounds of Sampson County, 1839; protest of H. Brockett, 1836; record of strays, 1827-1868; reports of marriage licenses issued, 1883, 1901, 1902; resignation of G.C. Highsmith as a justice of the peace, 1898; resolution on the death of Hardy Lucian Holmes, no date; resolution on the retirement of Judge David L. Ward, 1910.
In box C.R.087.928.4: road records, no date, 1799-1914 (broken series); school records, no date, 1880-1916 (broken series); slave records, 1832-1869 (broken series); solicitors' reports, 1848-1905 (broken series); testimony concerning Ann M. Reynolds application for a Civil War widow's pension, 1887; wardens of the poor, 1830-1848 (broken series).
